benchmark_details.name: MESH (Mise-En-Sc√®ne-Hallucinator)
benchmark_details.overview: MESH is a benchmark designed to evaluate hallucinations in Large Video Models (LVMs) systematically using a Question-Answering framework. The benchmark incorporates binary and multi-choice formats with target and trap instances, aligning with human video understanding.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the ability of Large Video Models to avoid hallucination results and replicate aspects of human understanding of video.

data.annotation: Using a Question-Answering framework with binary and multi-choice questions.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy measures the proportion of correct answers in both binary and multi-choice formats.
methodology.interpretation: An accuracy score closer to 1 indicates better performance in recognizing elements and actions within videos.
